name: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol, 3-methyl-
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3901
Reason: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol has a melting point that we can compare to benzene's value, which is around 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The basic unit for our compound is the pyrazole ring, which introduces rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and molecular volume, estimated at around -5°C.
